								You can buy cosmetic stuff. I hate Microtransactions, I believe they are the cancer of the gaming community. Anyways, this game only cost money if you want to acces the beta (Or you can get it for free from their site with luck).So, seeing this is a f2p game, I can understand the microtransactions part.Pro's:- It looks amazing - First person feels like you are really there- Decent button control.Cons:- Microtransactions (but it's f2p)- Horribly bad animations occur when you "crash" or fall.- You can't get off the skii's. (You are born with them it seems) - No Snowboarding.- No character customization whatsoever ( Custom face, female/male etc)

content:
Posted: December 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								Though I haven't played this game too much, I think I am capable of writing a solid review since there isn't too much in the game yet.  To start, I think this game is a very good start to what could potentially turn into the best free game on steam.  I will now do a pros and cons list.Pros:-graphics are very good for early stage-Rewind mechanic lets you fix mistakes easily if you want to hit that jump perfectly-though there are microtransactions, they are limited to asthetic only, and if this business model holds true I will be very happy-very interesting and fun map design (Main mountainous map)-Good frame rate/no frame dropping even at high speed (I am on an alienware 13 laptop)Cons:-in air controls can sometime feel clunky-needs a camera control feature so you can look around the enivironment-skiier is sometimes stuck in revers, and is hard to turn around-multiplayer needs more way to interact with other playersConclusion:If you are looking for a skiing game than you should be extremely excited for this one to release in full.  It has the chance to become a fantastic game.  What the devs need to work on is the controls and multiplayer, but it is understandable that these wouldn't be perfect as the game is clearly still in early development.  I would highly recommend this game to most people, especially those in the Northeast, like me, who have had no snow and need their skiing itch to be statisfied.  So far this game has helped me to keep my mind off the dissapointing lack of snow this winter.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								I found the controller controls to be harder to use than the keyboard, so I actually recommend the keyboard.  I just heavily recommend rebinding the "flip forward" key to anything other than the same key for "move forward" (W).  I use the 2 key.It's also frustrating having to start at the beginning of the run every time you crash, which for some maps (Bluesky Burgers) is incredibly annoying because you have to spend 15 seconds every time rounding the lodge before you even get to the course.  If there was an option to respawn just a little higher up the mountain from where you fell/crashed, that would make this game infinitely better.  OR just make it so a crash doesn't end your run -- make the player fall down, but let him get back up and keep going?  Just penalize the player with XP or something.As of now I really like the game, it's just these fixes seem so obvious that it's annoying to play knowing how easily it could be fixed.But regardless of those points, I do recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've owned this game since it was first released as closed beta or something on Steam when you still had to pay for the game. I've watched the game evolve from just a game you could ride around to what it is now. I don't know what I think about the games state right now, but it's still a lot of fun for a couple of hours. You have a few different maps, whereas there is one you'll probably find yourself playing on the most. The big mountain Sialia is the biggest free area in the whole game, and here you can find everything. Slopes, parks with both big and small jumps, rails, half pipes etc, and you can find some super cool off-piste lines by exploring yourself. Once you find a new spawnpoint, you can always come back there. Trickwise there are many. There are many cool grabs, although I would like to see even more combinations. You can rotate in every way possible. Backwards, forwards, do rolls, 360s and combine all of them for a sideflip or something else. This is good.Contentwise there are many maps to play, but as a free to play game you have to pay for most of them. I have not purchased anything other than the starterpack back when I first purchased the game, but I still find it fun when I have 30 minutes to do something, so purchasing anything isn't neccesary at all.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Keeping in mind this game is early access AND free to play, this game is amazing. The graphics are absolutely stunning. There could be more music tracks but the ones that are in game are great. Remappable controls were recently added and that makes things even easier to do. There are a few glitches here and there but the devs are very helpful and willing to communicate on the discussion forums. Though this game is free to play I'd be willing to pay upwards of $20 even for the state it is currently in. Snowboards and snowmobiles are coming soon along with many other updates and bug fixes which is even more incentive to keep playing. Keep up the great work guys, I can't wait to see what's to come.

Its a real shame that Valve doesnt make the rule for pre-existing purchases qualify so long as you haven't played the certain amount of hours on it, I am very upset with this and got really exciting about the possibility of returning it but alas, Valve teased me... :'(

number of helpful: 9 of 19 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20
Early Access Review
								I have over 100 games in my steam library and this is my FIRST review (I think...) so let that sink in for a moment before you judge my comments.This game has to be the most RAGE INDUCING piece of crud I have ever played, and I grew up playing Battletoads. I'm just going to keep it simple;PROS:- Great visuals and atmosphere.- Easy to use controls and can be used with a controller (recommended).- Awesome soundtrack (in my opinion, the most refined thing about the game).- It's free.CONS:- Touch a rock, you die.- You land slightly off, you die.- Touch ice, you die. (I'm serious, the amount of times I've landed softly on ice and died).- When you spawn at the start of an event, your character sometimes decided to go the wrong way.- The game feels empty, there just aren't enough players to make multiplayer feel worth it.- No Multiplayer events (not that I've found, maybe you have to pay)- When you die your board magically flies away and you have to respawn at the start (even in free mode) *like seriously, I'd much prefer it if my character got up, brushed themselves off and carried on.You might feel that my cons are over exaggerated, however I've been playing for just over 5 hours and already its making me develop cancer. It's a shame, it has potential, it's just not being used.

number of helpful: 7 of 15 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								SNOWBOARDING IS HERE. still needs some work, but its a ton of funAPRIL UPDATE-Snowboarding and snowmobiles on the way at the end of this month!(i know this isnt a real update to a review, that will come when they are actually implemented)P.S. Lulz @ skiholes who didnt like my review because of snowboard comments~OPEN BETA UPDATE~After a rough start the devs pumped out multiple hotfixes within a day and have the game up and running. definately worth checking out.also remember to harass the devs to add snowboarding like they said they were going to.~WRITTEN DURING CLOSED BETA~In a world where realistic extreme sports games are no more, especially on PC, SNOW is a light in the darkness. Thats not to say its without its problems though. Pros-Physics. I've worked as a liftie in Vt and can say the feel of being on snow/rails/boxes is all solid and in line with really cruising down a mountain-Optional First Person Mode. Why havent more extreme sports games done first person? there arent words to describe hitting a double cork 1080 in first person.-Open Mountain. you literally have accesss to the ENTIRE mountain. want trails? they are there. want a park? there are a few. want backcountry, go nuts.-Ragdoll Bails. While these arent the most realistic animations in the world, they will leave you cringing and laughing after you smash a rock at speedCons-No Snowboarding. This is a big one for me. when this game was on kickstarter the devs were promising snowboarding was going to be added as soon as the basics of skiing were in. this has not happened and there has been no news to hint that it is still planned. it leaves the mountains feeling like those douchey ski only resorts. wheres the boarder love?-rough multiplayer. the devs announced that they will be upgrading thier servers when the game goes to open beta. this is very much needed as a random lag spike can kill an amazing run down the mountain or ruin a nice freeroam follow the leader session-microtransactions. there are a lot of them. essentially everything to customize your rider costs real money (not much compared to some other games though) there also appears to be some "events" that you buy into with real money (havent tried these so i cant speak to much on them)-wierd snow behavior. i know i know, its a beta. but sometimes snow will magically leave a trail in the air behind you when you jump, and it stays that way even on your next run down the mountain, this isnt a major issue but can cause issues lining up jumps and grinds in the parks.Overall: is SNOW worth it?if you have been craving some realistic extreme sports or if you are a mountain lifer then this game is definately for you. if you like exploring in a relaxing setting this game is probably for you. if you want somethinglike tony hawks pro skater on skis, you should stay far far away.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								At the moment, I can not recommend this game.Horrible Slushy controls:I have an Xbox One controller, yet the game kept insisting on showing me a PS4 controller layout.Movement commands felt laggy, and my machine way out specs the recommendations.Very poor tutorials:Telling a person how to do something is okay, but SHOWING them first works much better.Freedom is a good thing, but when you have no real direction in order to know how to usesaid freedom, freedom can become a burden.Stale and empty enviroment:At no time did I ever feel like I was on a real mountain.With stark, simple graphics, no AI wondering around ANYWHERE, no wild life, no wind or weather effects,Just felt like I was entirely alone on top of a mountain that man hadn't been to in 50 years.There were a few small things I did like.First-Person Camera and sense of speed:I did like the sense of speed once you could actually get some speed, and I liked the movementof the first-person camera.If I had to pick right now between this and Steep, Steep would win.You need to decide if your going for a simulation or a game.It feels more like a sim at the moment, but lacks the fidelity and precision of a simulation.The game feeling is not present at all. No fun, or excitement to be felt at all.Will review again once game leave Early Access.But for now, I wouldn't recommend spending any real money on this.This game has a long way to go before it is finished.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								I understand that snow is now a Free To Play Beta, and that the game isn't expected to be perfect. I will just be saying how things are (for me and a lot of other people, not everyone). First off, SNOW is a lot of fun, singleplayer and (sometimes) multiplayer are great and the game has a lot of potential and it would be an amazing game if only... It worked, which it kinda doesn't at the moment. The game is constantly crashing (for me and a couple of others who tried out the game). Multiplayer is a mess.All the servers are mostly full because of the 12 players cap and they will always display that they have over 300+ ping when they actually don't. When hovering over someone's name in the spawnmenu the game will put a camera on them like you're spectating them. If you scroll through the players (unintetionally) the camera will glitch out and it might crash your game because the FPS drops to 0-2. Sometimes when you spawn, there will be random invisible walls right infront of you completely blocking your movement and it takes away all your points if you jump because of 'bad landing'. Sometimes the walls are placed a bit infront of you so after you gained some speed you instantly crash because of the god damn wall. Sometimes when other players spawn on you, it will make you crash instantly. These are the multiplayer problems I'm having, some might have the same, some might not.Singleplayer/EventsSingleplayer is a lot better than multiplayer in terms of the game working, but it gets easily boring skiing around by yourself. So you either jump into Multiplayer, or you go do some Events! (Since leveling up gives you no credits at all and you can unlock a yellow outfit through the events that are free. Now I warn you, if you haven't played the game or Events, this will frustrate the living **** out of you. Some Events are fairly easy, and some will make you rip your hair out. I'm not going to get into a lot of detail about this, but it kinda sucks that the events don't give you credits so you can buy your own gear instead of a boring yellow outfit. With all that said, the game is still worth downloading since it's free and it is fun, when it works.Like I said, I know this is a free to play beta and you can't expect too much from it just yet. I know the game will improve and I am definitely looking forwards to it.That's all I'm going to write for now..

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								Really, really. Just seriously, so many glitches I encounter, making me not getting to a save point, losing all of my points... This game isn't really something that you spend tons and tons of time on, as you will get frustrated from the glitches. Sometimes when I jump off, my character freezes and cannot do a command except for basic ones like, turning and really nothing else. This could actually be fixed by wiping out, but most of the time as I try, it doesn't happen. Only get this game if you have tolerance for its glitches. I can see that you might be saying; "IT WAS MADE IN OCT 2013!" Well, its 3 years from then, and they should've already fixed them. It is also really hard to level up in the game too, which makes buying new gear and making it easier, requiring for 10s of hours. Only get it if you like to just play around, not going for a highscore or something, as I know a glitch will mess you up. Also, I can see that they have been doing some fixes, but FOR ME it says the last update a month ago FOR ME. And they have pretty close updates too. So really, they probably don't know how to fix what is happening to me (and us) meaning they have a bad team. No offense. I have also heard that in MAY 2016 it still is in BETA after 3 years. I don't see any potential in the game, as other devs work harder than them, releasing the out-of-BETA version out in 3 months to 2 years MAX. Only buy this game if you just do it in your freetime, not to break your friend's highscore, as the glitches will mess you up.

								I absolutely love this game and can't wait for all the new features, especially snowboarding as a boarder myself. Graphics are brilliant and the character animations are smooth and fluid, you can tell most of the devs are skiers themselves. At the moment only one side of on mountain is available to ski, but even this was enough to keep me entertained for hours, there's hundreds of different paths to choose and jumps placed at regular intervals.Some things I would like added are working ski lifts or helicopter drops, AI skiers on the slopes too, and the park to be extended a bit more. Maybe add a proper winter olympics style ski jump somewhere too.And to all the people complaining about a lack of features, the big blue bar saying EARLY ACCESS might have given you a clue as to what you are paying for - do your research before you click buy!!!

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is my review of SNOW, an Early Access game about skis.The game is very hard to review without being picky, it's good and bad.The button help was for Xbox one and I used an Logitech Multi Mode controller, That was not really an issue.Pros:-The game was fun and was very in depth,-Even with regular physics fails the game ran perfectly smooth for such a big game,-Very calming,-Music was playing to fill in the lack of sound,-Drone mode, a great way to scout out the area before you ski.Cons:-Multiplayer was slow and clunky,-You have to unlock areas in the free roam meaning it wasnt really free roam,-The controller binds were dumb, Why would you bind X to go forward and not a trigger?-No music controls, I can't change to a different song on the fly,-Graphics settings are low by default, I had to do alot of tweaking to make it run,-No walk mode, I can't take in my surroundings while I am slipping around can I?Overall, I would recommend this game but not until loads of errors are ironed out of the game.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game should not be on Steam at all! It is broken and unplayable. Yes, you can say the game is in it's early alpha stages and I should expect bugs and general annoying gameplay. But when the developers announced that the game would be ready by Febuary of this year back in October of last and it isn't, well that just shows how little care they have for the game. I bought into the this game as the original discription that was on Steam at the first release of this half arsed early access, was snowboarding. At first they never pointed out that the snowboarding would be implimented later on in the game's life. All that was stated in the original discription is that the game was in early alpha and that it had some issues. I am sick and tired of developers throwing their game onto Steam as an "early access". It is terrible marketing and has already made me want to not play the game when it is fully released. If that ever happens! I shall remind you, this game was supposed to release as a free to play in Feb. It is no April and the game is yet to be released. If you are in need of money as a developer just to finish your game. Do not release it as an early access. Hype the game up, get better funding and make sure your target market knows about the game. I would have had no idea about this game as, from what I know, it has only been marketed on Steam. Get your♥♥♥♥♥♥together, developers! Stop releaseing paid, half arsed early access games with no guaranty that the game is even going to be release on time or even at all. I invested in this game because I thought at least one developer may get it right, but no. Just like the majority, they screw up and seem to have little to no care about the game itself and only the money. Now, after that rant, I can say some good things about this game. The graphics are beautiful. They really give the feeling of gliding through soft powder on a beautiful day. Or at least it does when it actually lets you spawn. The character customisation is actually good, with a wide range of branded products to chose from. Like K2 and Vokl. The mountain looks real and outstanding, especially in the highest settings. The game seems to run well with very little hiccups, even maxed out too. I honestly want to see this game succeed in a big way. But the way it is now and the way the developers failed to deliver a Febuary launch just take hope away. I am truly wanting a good snowboard/skiing sim to play as none that I have sunk any time or effort into have been rewarding. Games like Shaun White Snowboarding and Stoked are good but not outstanding. If the developers are able to pull all of this out of the bag, even with all the issues that it shouldn't have this far into the development of the game, I will recomend it. But right now, with all the issues and my personal hatred for early access game at this time, I can not recommend this game to anyone. I have hope for this game eventually turning out fantastic. But for now, it is slim. Every month I will pop back onto the game and give another test. And each time, I will edit this review. I hope for the better.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
Early Access Review
								Check out SNOW and my thoughts on it in my YouTube video here:


YouTube™ Video:  

			Views: 0		



In general, the game shows a lot of promise. The mountain looks great and the physics feel balanced. It is not nearly as over the top as SSX, which I like.  What a lot of people need to realize is that this game is VERY Early Access. There is only 1 mountain (and a training slope if you want to count that), no sound, plenty of bugs, and NO multiplayer at the moment (partially untrue as of writing, I could as a Founder create a lobby and invite a friend). Pros currently:Crytek engine looks great. The mountain look phenominal.Physics feel polished and standard movement feels natural.Quite a few brands have signed on for support of the game (Redbull, K2, etc)The open world layout feels right for a skiing game.Cons currently. Keep in mind these will be improved on in later builds, but this is only for current.No MultiplayerNo SoundNumerous bugsNo tutorial worth mentioning and controls for tricks are a bit clunky.Only 1 mountain with only 1 of 4 faces containing spawn points. Many parts of that mountain unfinished.Lot of goals, but only 3 people on the dev team so progress may be slow.This is a early alpha build and some could argue this is only slightly more than a tech demo.No way to provide early backer rewards currently.With that being said the game is worth checking out if snow sports are your thing. Just keep in mind, you are paying to support the developer on this, as it will be released F2P. DO NOT BUY if you are not OK with the things I mentioned above. Simply wait it out and try it when it's released and F2P.

								For anyone that likes games similar to tony hawk and skate this is for you!It is an open world ski game that can be both relaxing and thrilling.The open world allows for great exploration.Game is even better with friends because the wipeouts can be especially rediculous.Some problems with the game is to get to some locations you need to be a high rank to unlock the helicopter location, but this can be bypassed by getting to the bottom and taking the helipad.Another problem is that the game glitches and can possibly crash the game on a bad wipe.All in all, the game is pretty solid for the price and even without more updates I am satisfied with my purchase.Too much snow 9/10 -IGN

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I don't normally review games, but SNOW has so much potential that i feel i have to give my feedback on it.First of all, it's a great idea, there's no other games like this and the free-roaming skiing premise has not been done very much before. Bearing in mind that it's completely free-to-play, i think it very good. It's still got many bugs, but as a free to play early access that only to be expected. There's a huge variety of maps, and the controls are relatively easy to get the hang of.However, the new update has caused my character to die whenever i get dropped off, meaning only snowboarding works as an option, which is very frustrating as skiing feels more fluid at the moment. Also, the charcter model has completely disappeared (if intentional this really detracts from the game), so my skier has is merely a floating hat and gloves, with no body.Would I recommend? Yes. its free, so why not? There are many bugs and it's certainly still in early stages, but there is huge potential here, and a finished product could be outstanding.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is muy first review and what to keep it as fair and true as possible.The proson the upside the game is a very good idea and can see it going very far, dispite my short time playing it micro transactions didnt seem to be game changers, only visuals. Im sure in a few months to a years time the game will be absolutely brilliant, cram packed with content.The game is a very small file, approx 3-4GB meaning it will be downloaded fairly quickly. The consUpon startup the game crashed 3 times, then had an enourmous loading screen ( i dont know if this was a bug or if the game is just slow) upon entering the game you notice that it is clearly your steryotypical early access, very buggy, glitchy and a very clunky experience. Alongside that the visuals are very dated (dispite being run on cryengine).i believe this game has a lot of promise and is very likely to go far, however at the moment it just isnt shining, it still needs a lot of work (which i appreciate as it is early access).Overall i would rate the game a 5/10 it shows promise but at the date of writing this the game is nothing special

								I love skiing. This game is tagged as "Simulation" but to be honest, it isn't that realistic. The physics is pretty weird and glitchy, in a lot of situations the character should die miserably... but he doesn't even fall.Maybe "arcade" or "casual" would be more appropriate.SNOW is still in beta, so maybe will change... but I don't think so.This doesn't mean that the game is bad. It's a F2P and there are tons of terrible paid games on steam.If you want give it a try, don't be afraid of the "mixed", the game is not a masterpiece but it isn't trash too.Looks like someone paid for this game, that's why there are a lot of negative reviews: devs decided to go from paid game to F2P with micro-transactions, I would be♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥too, bad move.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
Early Access Review
10/10 !!This is definitely the best skiing game I've ever played, and it still is. The recently implemented new mechanics are not as good as they could be, but the developers already told us fixes are coming with the 0.5.1 patch.Well... After the closed beta update, 0.5.0, people are whining a lot about the new changes. Especially because they can't get their cosmetic items (for free!), which does absolutely nothing, besides making you look a little unique. You can still ride all the mountains, try out all the events, and you're certainly not limited by any micro-transactions gameplay-wise. You can use all the grabs, ride just as fast, and compete in just as many events as you want to - FOR FREE!This is what I would like to see in EVERY Free-to-Play game. Where you ONLY have to (optionally) pay for cosmetic items. Here in SNOW, as it is in 0.5.0, you can't pay to get BETTER. You can only look slightly 'cooler'.On a whole 'nother note, here's a few quotes by a few developers from Poppermost, the company who makes the game SNOW, regarding the new shop and the new mechanics:1. Asurao: "We have no plans to charge you for new levels/mountains. We want everyone to be able to ride together whether they've spent money or not. This is core to the game." and "There will be many ways to earn credits in the future".(>>Source<<)2. Rubadubdub!: "I can ensure you that there will be other ways of getting new gear in the future, so you'll still be able to get pretty good gear just like in TF2, CS: GO etc."(>>Source<<)3. Asurao: "As we continue working towards Open Beta (0.6.0) we will be adding player progression (a leveling system) so that you can earn items without having to buy them">>Source<<4. Asurao: "I agree that the break-turn isn't working as intended and overall speed management feels very sporadic. We're looking into this and will make improvements in future updates."(>>Source<<)

content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								If we assume that its early access then we can talk about future improvements. The game is full of backs starting from the menu and finishing inside the mountains. A lot of crashes for no actual reason. And another small problem is all these microtransactions. You cant buy even a new shirt without real money. BUTThis game has a great potential and can become a really successful game if the devs make it right. Graphics looks great , gameplay with some improvements can become even greater, maps are wonderful , music is cool (considering some1 is using it) and this minimalistic menu style is really cool.What needs to be done? I believe that devs must go from a free to play game with microtransactions to a priced game with no microtransactions. If they keep the game like that they have a 90% chance to fail hard. But if they fix the bugs(that they will fix , dont forget its early access) and make it a game you actually buy and then you are good to go then they will have a great success in my opinion. After all its a great idea so I will rate with 7.5/10. Ohhh and devs... Please add snowboards in the game.<3

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								Do you appreciate skiing/snowboarding? Do you love games like SSX?Do you love huge open world games?Then this game is for you! SNOW is a great free-to-play game with no features of a pay to win. The only thing you can buy are extra credits which allow you to unlock extra gear (but you get these overtime anyways). The controls are fluid and very refined making it easy to learn but hard to master. There's just nothing like plowing through some fresh powder or hitting a 540 Corkscrew in first person. Only downside is you basically NEED some sort of controller to play it (mouse and keyboard ain't going to cut it) but they're pretty cheap and easy to find.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								As of current, SNOW is in Pre-Alpha, and as its being developed by just three people, it'll be like this for a while. SNOW is not flawless, and does have its fair share of bugs. One major flaw is that there is no audio, but one good fix I found is to have some music in the background, something fast paced, as you ski past all these rocks and obstacles that never seem to stop coming. Controls need a little bit of work, and they will arrive in due time.I honestly reccomend this game to people who like sking/winter sports, or just enjoy crashing their skier into a couple hundred obstacles.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
Early Access Review
								Snow is a very relaxing but very fun game for everyone even thoose who arent exactly into skiing like myself. One of the major problems that i think the game badly needs is AUDIO as that is a must but they are bringing this out at a later date. The game is also very immersive which adds to the experience with its beautifull visuals like the sun light creeping over the mountains really makes it feel real. One feature that i personally like alot is the in game store which has alot of licsensed merchandise that you can wear. The fact that they are bringing out multiplayer, snowboarding, audio and all the updates to come will complete this game and easily make it so much more enjoyable than what it is already. There are a few bugs which im sure will be fixed as soon as possible, ive noticed very little for an early alpha game so you should be fine theres nothing really ive seen that will ruin your experience in the game. Overall i would reccomend buying this game even though it will be free some time next year as it is still a great experience and may even interest you in theese sports. The developers have made an outstanding job keep it up guys!

content:
Posted: May 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Sadly at this time I can't recommend the game.  As a snowboarder and a huge fan of winter sports games, the controls are sluggish, the xbox controls often don't work or fail completely.  Cannot gain speed, movement feels wonky, the moves are not precise at all, etc.  This is early access so it's understandable that this will all be fixed in the future (hopefully).  I believe the potential is there for the game... it could be great with a lot of improvement.  For now, my take is skeptical at best.  Oh and they need to optimize better; my system far exceeds the recommended specs but my frame rate is as slow as molasses as well as the game itself.  I wanted to pull what little hair I have left in my head out and eventually quit before I rage quit lol.  I will give one positive comment: the music is excellent to say the least.  They picked the perfect tracks to give the down-hill experience exactly what it needs, so bravo on that account.

								This game is pretty damn good for a FTP title, (Think Skate 3...in the snow) if you liked SSX, Cool Borders for psx and any of those skateboard/snowboard downhill big air type games this is the game for you. Leveling up is really easy. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ignore the negative reviews, SNOW is an outstanding skiing game and blows other free-to-play games out of the water. SNOW has everything that makes a good game in one big package. First off the graphics look outstanding, almost as if I'm actually on a mountian. Amazing UI its basic and gets the job done. Multiplayer works and allows you to race with friends and explore the beautiful landscapes this game can offer. I am not a huge fan of skiing and I had a blast, anyone who likes a game that can offer ANY of the above should instantly download SNOW. Its free-to-play but it does not shove its microtransactions in your face. Never while I was playing did I feel forced to buy any credits as the game offers them from regular play. You have nothing to lose by giving this great game a chance and It is a project I will continue to follow and support.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game should be considered game of the decade. I've spent way more time in this game than I would like to admit, but that's because its simple controls yet tall skill ceiling, coupled with the many singleplayer maps and hilariously buggy multiplayer action keep me interested day in and day out.This game is fun to play alone, but even better with friends, especially when you turn them into tombstones in the middle of their trick combos. The physics are realistic until you begin to intimate friendly discussion with solid objects, and then all reality breaks down. There are multiple easter eggs and hidden areas deep into the Siala map that I'm still discovering.The cosmetics in this game are purely that, cosmetic. I've only managed to gain about 140 currency in the 14 levels I've put in, but you can purchase more in the store. Items range from hats worn by actual skiers and snowboarders to horse masks and knight helmets.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is really enjoyable and ran smoothly on my pc. High quality textures and a very large draw distance. I highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoys skiing. This game has a big learning curve but it's really fun and has a very high replay value. (It's really hard to land tricks perfectly) The tutorial is garbage, I didn't learn anything in it and I never passed the third part where you have to land a 720 spinning jump, I don't know the button combinations. The best way is to free-play on the mountain. There are some bugs but they aren't game breaking. Sometimes I hit something and I crash and on the next run I hit the same object but it just affects my score instead of having me go back.This game has a lot of potential and is already expanse. I wish that the lifts were operational and you could ride them. I also wish that there was a map because I've gotten lost quite a few times. TL;DR = Don't buy unless you are a skiing enthusiast, just wait until it’s f2p

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								For what it is this game is awesome. I think with continued development of more mountains and more events it will be super solid. Its got good mechanics, easy to pick up but hard to master. Like all early access games it has its moments. Grinding right now is by far the most underwhelming thing in the game but the last few updates have been making it a lot better. Its no Tony Hawk "Press X to do tricks" its more like the Skate games where you actually had to do some prep work for your tricks, like aligning your trajectories and landing properly or death. Also, to go along with the Skate games the massive and brutal crashes make this game a total riot. Ragdolling down the mountain in this game is as funny as Goat Simulator but without the "why am I even playing this?" vibe. Hoping when all is said and done that snowboarding and snowmobiles are well executed and I would love to see a mountain editor. Keep up the good work devs!

								What is this crap?I bought this long time ago.Now i try to play again, despite having a bad feeling caused by previous playtime.And OMG nothings changed, at least not in positive way.FPS is even lower than before.I run GTA5 at High settings across surround (triple screen) 5240x1080But this game even at low settings cant reach stable 60 FPS.Within a few minutes i was down the hill from the top.The whole ride was short and not interresting at all.And what happend below the bottom?Well i found out that all detail was gone, trees floating above the ground, weird textures glitches from shading happend there, and no guidance to some spot where it would continue or stop the game.Instead i felt of the edge of the level, no timeout to send me to ground again nothing.I previously asked steam for a refund on this because i think its a scam.This game is bad.Many want it to be good (even me) but as i see it, this will never happen.This game will be a turd.And they are trying to make it shine.I think it will never be optimized, so always bad FPS.The end of level is a empty zone filled with bugs.The ragdoll effects are a joke.The whole animation is a joke...This game is a money grab.And they will grab all they can before this company will fanish in history.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								SNOW is a free to play skiing simulator that is absolutely BADASS.From the 7 hours I have played of this game, I am throughly enjoyed. PC has never gotten a skiing/snowboarding game ever and this game is the perfect way to start. Graphics:Absolutely beautiful. Best graphics I have seen in a very long time and it is also coded amazingly. I can run the game on Ultra at 60 fps and my computer really isn't that good.Movements:As of right now, you can tell the movements they have now are place holders. The body is very stiff and moves more like a robot. You can tell by the movements that the game is still in early beta. Obviously the ragdoll is terrible, but none the less is really funny waatching your guy flop down the hill with a few broken bones and a twisted neck.Music/Sounds:Adrian Blood.. What can I say? The music is amazing. It's the perfect feel of chill and EDM. If I was to go skiing one day, this will be the music I listen to. The sounds are high quality and match with the game very well.Maps:Perfectly designed. The most of the maps on the game are based off of real places.What I Would Like To See:Snowboards! We know they are coming and it will be awesome when they come. Map Creator! It would be awesome making your own tracks and having races on the tracks you make with your friends.Custom Graphics! Would be so cool to make your own clothing and make your own designs on the skis.Do I recommend this game? HELL YEAH!It's free to play! If you want to buy clothing and other in game stuff, better fork out some big bucks because the cheapest thing is $5 for 500 in game coins that can buy you a jacket, pants, gloves, and a mask. None the less, all the tracks are free and its free to play multiplayer.Cons:Super expensive and hard to earn coins.(I got for leveling up to level 5 10 coins. 10 coins can't buy me anything in the game. The cheapest thing in the game is 89 coins and its a damn party hat.)Summary: Super fun! Great graphics! Great music! HUNDREDS of items to choose from! Can't buy♥♥♥♥♥♥ I RECOMMEND!

content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
Early Access Review
Snow is a great F2P skiing/ snowboarding simulator, reminiscent of the Skate franchise. It features both singleplayer and multiplayer game modes, with a healthy community to play around with.  Graphically the game is gorgeous! It uses the CryEngine, which allows advanced options for configuration. The neverending mountains really are a treat for the eye here, folks.  You'll also be skiing down the slopes, listening to the euphoric ambient music, accompanying you through the hills. Snow also offers you some nice, relaxing custom tracks to soothe you. It's a surprise how well the controls handle! Even when using a keyboard, the controls are easy to get the hang of and master. Rarely do they cause problems. It's nice to know that the game supports gamepads, too. Snow offers natural character progression. It's quite simple - the more you play, the better you get. There is a variety of character customization options, you can be decked out from head to toes. These cosmetic items do require in-game purchases, but you can obtain credits for them through playing. As a third option, there is always the communtiy market. Only remarks. While everything else is great, the physics need some refining. There are some awkward moments with the character movement and object collision. Grinding, in particular, is terrible. While the developers have given us a product of high quality, Snow falls a little short of being the next big thing, for the moment at least.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Let me start by saying THANK YOU for not creating an SSX.  But...So far, this game still isn't at par with most simulator type skiing\snowboarding games that have already been on the market.  The character is stiff, weightless, and too obviously procedurally driven.  It looks and feels like you are controlling the skiis not the rider.  The controls are very binary when they should take advantage of modern analog controllers. For instance, regardless if you tap the steering controls or hold, the character drops right into the extremity of the turning poses.  Same for grabs and any other feedback coming from the character. There is no sense of speed unless you are in the trees. The levels feel wide open, flat, and tricking opportunities are sparse. The jumps in the parks feel dauntingly huge and are seemingly too big for the lack of speed even at max speed.   The physics feel just as binary as the controls and don't work well with the level design metrics for the terrain or park obstacles.  Rails riding is quirky and the rider looks dorky. Halfpipe riding is frustrating and it's nearly impossible to get any speed\air.  The radgoll is just broken, and bailing in any game other than EA Skate isn't fun. It's punishing and wastes a players time.  The best parts of this game are the jump on the right thumbstick (thank you EA Skate) when it works and doesn't give you an awkward emote instead. As well, a huge plus is having the generous ability to customize the ingame camera.  This game has a long way to go before Beta.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								This  game is fun. I missed all the "extreme" sports games that the consoles used to have. Games like 1080 Avalanche and Tony Hawk Pro Skater always had a nice mix of sick tricks and groovy clothing options that always allowed for a fun time. This game has both and its doing it in the right direction.For start, this game is in early access and there are plenty of bugs. With this aside, the dev team is working hard to make the gameplay mechanics, such as the actual movement and physics, extremely polished. As of right now, the skiing elements feel as they should. You are now wondering, "hey bruh, wut bout my snowboard?! I want to be the next Dion Blaster....errr Ricky Winterboard...." As of right now the devs are currently working on the skiing mechanics alone; focusing all their efforts before transitioning to snowboards. While this may seem upsetting, I will remphasize that the skiis are nicely done. This aspect should not deter you from giving this game a try.The game itself is centered around a few areas and one giant mountain that people can skii around. This I feel is the best aspect of the game. Every location feels new.  Any path you travel lacks the strategically placed fallen tree or mountain face that forces you to go in any given direction. While there are paths to follow, there is nothing stopping you from carving your own trail.The game itself looks awsome too. I dont know how hard it was to paint a mountain white, but it is incredibly satisfying to look around while skiing. With this in mind, The dev team is supporting the occulus rift, which is a step in the right direction. I often put myself in first person mood to get a better immersion while going down the mountainside and the rift will probably provide a better experience. I guess the only "downside" to this game, which isnt really a bad thing, is that this game will be F2P. The game will charge the players for buying different clothing. Who are they to tell me that I have to wear clothes..... pff!This will be a more mature version of the "extreme" sports I used to enjoy on the consoles. Knowing this, I cant wait to take all the skill I learned in SNOW and apply it to real skiing.....

content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've put in 14hours in this game just as something to do when Im bored or need a break from work, and I have a very mixed opinion on it, while I actually love the way it feels and handles a lot of people seem to dislike it, I just think it a little to realistict (other than crash physics) for people to get comfortable with right away, which IMO is a good problem to have, since I started I went from not being able to control myself going down hillstso seeing how much points I can rack up in a single run. However it's progression that destroys this game and I get it this is free to play there has to be something that makes players want to spend some money on the game and in most cases f2p games use vanity items to incite a purchase but I've never had a game feel so restrictive charater design wise just to get you to pay for it, you start with literally zero options to customize your character with all the shop items costing more than what you have, with earning more money almost out of the question, for example, after almost twenty level up's I've earned around 150 or less of the in game currency  which around the cost of a single item in game. I've try'd in game events to win money and got nothing, and some times even the level ups give you a fast travel marker instead or absolutly nothing at all, so really it feels like the game is going no where. Another part of the games still very lacking is the maps you can play on though far more forgivable with the game still being so new its hard to get excited when you know they're gonna cost in game currency just to open, and we already know thats impossible to get a substancial amount without buying it.  I think that it's sad they're trying so hard to force players to pay them for a full expirence when we constantly see F2P games being wildly SUCCESFUL BECAUSE PEOPLE CHOOSE to pay money for small perks like exp boosts and skins etc... and  FAIL BECAUSE PEOPLE ARE FORCED to pay for a full expirience. So IMO this game will inevitably fail if this isn't fixed and for now im not going to recommend this game maybe down the line my opinion will change.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								 This game is great. If you're a fan of the skate series you'll love this. This game balances realistic and super fictional skiing just right.  SNOW looks great visually, but I wish there were more snow particle effects. I have nothing bad to say about the controls, they're just fine the way they are. If you decide to try this game out remember it's still early access and there's still that has to be added to the game. I'll edit this review with some more information later.To all the early access player complaining about the new update.You payed for alpha acess and the alpha items, not for the rest of the clothing options. They made it pretty clear thats what you would receive , and you recieved it. Nothing more, nothing less. They do care about the people who funded their work, they gave us more than two weeks to play before anyone else could. We all knew it would be F2P and they'd have to make money somehow. And besides, all this 'Exclusive Content' is purely cosmetic, it doesn't affect gameplay at all. If you don't want to spend money buying the gear, wait untill they add their progress system. You'll be able to unlock stuff that way. They respond to A LOT of the questions and feedback given by the community, and take them into account. Poppermost is one of the best dev teams I've ever seen.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well I bought this game near the start of early access process.  I began and it was a very enjoyable, arcade style skiing game.  I admired that they weren't afraid to try something new.  After M2 was released however, I noticed things were changing (no duh its still in development), but the changes weren't positive.  The ability to do almost anything in the air or on a rail was pretty much gone.  I went from triple corking to barely doing a single cork.   Of course I thought that this was to be expected so I stopped playing it for about 4 months.  Now M4 is being released soon and I thought I'd give it another go.  I think it is worse than the last time I played it.  I am getting severe lagging, the gfx are brutal (worse than I remembered) the physics are crazy.  Still can't do much for tricks.  The preload system is severly flawed, it seldom works like it is suppose to.  Not to mention the devs are devolping a PS4 version of the game.  Like WTF!  The computer version is hardly playable and yet they are doing a ps4 version as well.  Long story short.  DONT BUY THIS GAME NOW!  Maybe in a year or two it will be playable and enjoyable but right now it isnt!

content:
Posted: May 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								I normally don't like to review early access games but this one just needs a bump in the help department.The menu UI has delayed response when navigating. Even with a good pc that I have it still seemed underwater. Which leads me to the gameplay. Can I get some crack for my snowboarder? I feel like I could walk backwards in skiis faster than the speed you have on the slopes, you just don't get enough to build up for a jump. Approacing a ramp or rail the jump doesn't seem to work in relation to where your location is.  Looking for that burst to leap onto the rail it doesn't work. The tutorial is busted. I get to where you have to preform basic grabs and a 360. Everything works fine but checking off the basic grab results in reset after reset. It says to hold LB or RB for a basic grab however upon doing that it does not register I have done the grab. During free roam can we defualt replays to off? Its too easy to get stuck trying to get out of it. Also most players will be on a keyboard or an xbox controller, yet during the controls screen you obviously display a ps4 controller. Not saying gamers don't use that controller, just seems weird to display the ps4 controller yet tell me to jump with A and the other xbox specific buttons.The graphics will do for what they are. It is kind of hard to imagine this is the cryengine at work.Incorporate some really nice ragdoll physics and boost the speed up 10x and this can be really fun and enjoyable.I desperately have been wanting a good shredding snowboarding game that was quality. I will keep my eye on this title, just seems a lot more technical issues are still being tweaked. Thank you for allowing me to test your game. I will check back when the speed of the game is increased.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								Ok, i find it really nice that it's free and the game got potentional. It can be the PC version of a good open world winter action sport game. The music in the game is also decent, i found that to be one of the pros of the game. However that said, this game is just anoying in every turn. The controls are really bad. It feels unnatural and uncontrolleble, and i can't figure out why they made the controls so weird for PC. We got a mouse, it's not that difficult to make use of it in a better way than what they have. For a game that sells on good physics, it isn't that good. it's glitching and going crazy all the time. There are little to non ragdolls effects. I mean come on, the ragdoll effect is what makes a game like this really fun, and it's just not there. You feel really slow when trying to gain speed aswell. Often i found myself trying to get as much speed as possible, then realize i didn't get enough for a high jump. There are anoying menus all over the place that dosn't help you. It just takes up time and makes you wonder why they made it like that. If you fail a part of a quest, do they ask if you want to restart the part of the quest? Nope, they let you ride to the finish line knowing that you can't complete it all without restarting everything. I can also smell micro transaction a mile away in the finished product. And the game isn't stable, but hey. It's beta so that's expected. For a free game in beta that got potentional, i would give it 5/10 for now. They need a lot of fixing to make this a good game in my opinion.

Boo.

content:
Posted: March 12
Early Access Review
								I understand why this game is widely praised, but, to put it simply, playing this game Vanilla is impossible. It's the most pay-2-play game I've ever played, and I'm highly experienced in mobile games.Let's tell a story.I was playing this game and was having a bit of fun, but decided to try another sport out. It was snowmobile. It didn't work. No error message, no HUD popup, nothing. So I pause and go into the menu. I see there's a snowmobile section in the buy menu, so i click it. Everything is gone, there's nothing there. I do a bit of searching come to find out it's just under 5 dollars to pay for the unlock, and just under one dollar to pay for the snowmobile itself, not to mention it's not even there.It's $1.00 USD PLUS for cosmetic items, which makes no sense to me, but I really don't care about cosmetics. Doesn't matter.What matters is content. Release the snowmobile for free instead of for 5 dollars. This is still a money-grabbing ♥♥♥♥♥ of a game. Maybe when it's out of Early Access and it's a couple dollars for everything, I'll play this game, but when they have unfixable bugs in the game, it's terrible. This includes being permanently windowed, buggy controls, and if you're serious about this type of game, don't play. It's just a major glitchfest, and that's the only reason it's fun. The rewind controls are♥♥♥♥♥♥unless you have a controller. The regular controls are♥♥♥♥♥♥unless you have a controller. Don't get this game; free or not, it's not even worth your human will or the time to install it. Buy STEEP. Seriously.I do not reccomend. Not at all.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's in Alpha right now so, unlike a beta, there are major game pieces missing not the least of which is all sound; there's no environment sounds, no skiing sounds, no music.. there's no sound. There are also a lot of the "planned" features missing at this stage but that is VERY normal for an alpha.. this is a true alpha where the major portions of the game are still being developed and only 10 to 20 percent of content is in the game, that is enough for the testing of the game.Having said all of that, I've found my multiple plays of the game satisfying and enjoyable. The core game is playable but of course those who are wanting more than essentially a tech demo, you should stay away until it is developed some more. It is going to be free2play as well, so if you can wait till later this year, you can get it for free.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								I would've recommended the game about a month ago, and to be honest i did to a bunch of friends of me. I enjoyed this game thoroughly and liked the freeform, freestyle gameplay of it and the (relatively) good graphics and gameplay were a treat to experience.Unfortunately after the latest update i can no longer recommend this game to anybody. Not that the addition of snowboards and snowmobiles aren't nice, on the contrary (waited for a long time for those). But the whole "pushing forward" motion to get around on skis is broken, so that you now only can tuck, making the whole process of starting your run down the mountain pretty tedious. YOu will be sliding down the first part of the run at about a mile per hour for the first 10 minutes before you actually make some speed and pushing youself a small bit up a slope is completely making every run slow and boring. Too bad, because the previously mentioned additions (though hidden behind microtransactions) are really cool. Too bad, man.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								I know this is 'Early Access'... but it's lifeless and dull. The lighting is non-existent, the sense of speed completely absent. There's hardly any particle effects of snow, wind or any feel of different types of snow or ice. Considering the game is called SNOW.. you'd expect it to at least feature some snow?!The Animations are placeholder and poorly blended, on top of this the characters are lifeless and devoid of charcater.The text rendering is horrible.Sound isn't working at all (at least on my machine anyway)Admittedly, I played this on Keyboard, so it's going to be flawed.. but come on, the controls are crap!I'd suggest you guys get yourselves a PS one and play Cool boarders... down tools trying to make it look better, and work out the physics... as far as i can tell you're just as fast down-hill as you are up, there's no feeling of sliding on snow at all.. I know game dev isn't easy guys, and this must have taken a while to get here, but seriously... I'd pull this and come back when you're happy with it.. because, well.. you can't be pleased with this! Also, just a tip... hire someone do light the level properly, or at least purchase a unity licence that'll let you proper lighting.. it's grey and lifeless at the moment.. ask yourselves: Why do people ski?FUN! - Your game isn't fun...

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Dont let the good reviews fool you. This game is trash.So there is no mid us servers so if you live in like Texas you have to deal with 100+ ping.Everything about this game is terrible. You crash in flat areas. You crash on ares where you should be allowed to ramp. when you crash, your guy dosen't fall down and get himself back up, he gets marked my a tombstone like he died. I will crash when my guy hits a 5 foot jump sideways and die? Why wont you just be allowed to get back up and try again? The manuvering (say when your jumping) is so SLOOWWW... There isnt even much areas where you can get up high enough to do a flip and actully land it. Might as well taken out that feature entirely. And once you "die" you can't get placed at the top of the mountain again. You have to spawn on someone like your playing battlefield and sometimes they could be at the top, but other times there just finishing. Why couldent that be just an option? Why couldent you just spawn at the top? There are so many obstacles on the slopes that wouldent be there in real life ski resorts. Why is there a giant rock arch in the middle of a slope? Are we in snowy Arizona or something? And when you hit one thats like a ramp shape which you should be able to go off (a lot of these are smooth, curved, and looks like they were delibretly placed there to be a ramp) you cant go over! You crash and "die" by hitting a small rock formation thats shaped like a ramp. This game is terrible and I can't belive how many people like it.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								For casual fans of winter sports, this game checks all the boxes- X Games tie-in, big tricks, and lots of licensed brands. But for the real winter sport athletes- this game sucks.After snowboarding for close to 10 years now, I think I can make comment on how unrealisitic and inconsistent the collisions are in this game. Whenever I crashed into the orange safety netting, instead of being tied up or slowed down by it, I was bounced off of it like a rubber ball, and hurled over the chair lift tower.If you clip a rock with the tail of your board, you aren't spun around or lose balance mid air and crash. You are instead ejected out of your bindings and thrown.Landing on flat surfaces is hyper inconsistent. You could launch a jump 3 times the exact same way, land in the same spot, and get three diferent outcomes.And from time to time, when you do an event that starts you in a timing house, you can get stuck when you try to push out and crash immediately. And also, you would think that with this many brands neing licesnsed, you would get a bigger pool of starting gear. WRONG. You have no helmet, no goggles, and one choice for everything else. The only way to get more gear is by running through and completing events, or microtransactions. (I would normally be fine with microtransactions, but only if the game gave you incentives to buy items - like CSGO and Rocket League crates)But hey, if you like running through the same slopestyle course 20 times because you keep crashing in the gate house, this is for you.

								This game has a lot of potential but at the moment I wouldnt recommend that you play it. Also the maps need more because to be honest they are plain and have nothing really on them to do. Basically what im trying to say is upgrade EVERYTHING and add things to the game what people may find interesting. Im not hating on this game because like I said it has potential but I really think it needs improving. content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've got this game since it's on steam early access, first it took ages to get the snowboarding in it, was promes long before. but now it's out and I finally tested it, I think it's to slow, if you mess up the landing of a trick you end up stand still and will have to push for ages before you regain some speed.. even then speed sensations is not good at all.the tricks are ok to executes, the rotation are difficult to control, you often spin without controlling the velocity and style.far to many rocks on a slope... ok this is suppose to be a mountain in the Alps, but common ! there is not fast enough response from the controls to avoid collisions and collision are to easy, any small clipping will end up with bad crash, impossible to recover.graphics look ok..ish, don't get me wrong this is good looking, but when you see title like Steep coming out fall 2016... ! I think Snow took to long to come to the stage of development it is now and it feels clumsy  with the controls, the trail of the snow from the back of the player while in normal camera looks glitchy, your snowboard or skis will just dives in the terrain... I do still recommend it, as it still quite fun, but could really do with some big inprovements with speed and controls

content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've got this game since it's on steam early access, first it took ages to get the snowboarding in it, was promes long before. but now it's out and I finally tested it, I think it's to slow, if you mess up the landing of a trick you end up stand still and will have to push for ages before you regain some speed.. even then speed sensations is not good at all.the tricks are ok to executes, the rotation are difficult to control, you often spin without controlling the velocity and style.far to many rocks on a slope... ok this is suppose to be a mountain in the Alps, but common ! there is not fast enough response from the controls to avoid collisions and collision are to easy, any small clipping will end up with bad crash, impossible to recover.graphics look ok..ish, don't get me wrong this is good looking, but when you see title like Steep coming out fall 2016... ! I think Snow took to long to come to the stage of development it is now and it feels clumsy  with the controls, the trail of the snow from the back of the player while in normal camera looks glitchy, your snowboard or skis will just dives in the terrain... I do still recommend it, as it still quite fun, but could really do with some big inprovements with speed and controls

content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game needs a tremendous amount of work put into it it. This game in its current state is extremely bare bones with only 3 mountains only one of which you is for free riding the other two are small parks. The graphics on this game are beautiful though that is one of the positives. The fluidity of the gameplay is pretty smooth but that is negated by the lack of a good free riding mountain with very little jumping off points to do many tricks and at the bottom there is no end you just find yourself stuck on flat ground. I cannot recommend anybody buying this game in its current state, and by looking at the devs timeline of features they would have in this game by now they are very far behind which makes me question how seriously they are developing this game. This game has great promise, but that is all dependant on whether or not you believe the developers to be putting our money back into developing this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								For casual fans of winter sports, this game checks all the boxes- X Games tie-in, big tricks, and lots of licensed brands. But for the real winter sport athletes- this game sucks.After snowboarding for close to 10 years now, I think I can make comment on how unrealisitic and inconsistent the collisions are in this game. Whenever I crashed into the orange safety netting, instead of being tied up or slowed down by it, I was bounced off of it like a rubber ball, and hurled over the chair lift tower.If you clip a rock with the tail of your board, you aren't spun around or lose balance mid air and crash. You are instead ejected out of your bindings and thrown.Landing on flat surfaces is hyper inconsistent. You could launch a jump 3 times the exact same way, land in the same spot, and get three diferent outcomes.And from time to time, when you do an event that starts you in a timing house, you can get stuck when you try to push out and crash immediately. And also, you would think that with this many brands neing licesnsed, you would get a bigger pool of starting gear. WRONG. You have no helmet, no goggles, and one choice for everything else. The only way to get more gear is by running through and completing events, or microtransactions. (I would normally be fine with microtransactions, but only if the game gave you incentives to buy items - like CSGO and Rocket League crates)But hey, if you like running through the same slopestyle course 20 times because you keep crashing in the gate house, this is for you.

I uninstalled it and went on with my life.just yesterday i decided i'd reinstall because i'd thought they had to have fixed it by now. nope.its gotten worse, the menu can cause a seizure and you can't get into the actual game let alone the store.second worse decision ive made in my life -6 stars.( i realize it's indie and it's not perfect but DAMN if they could fix the bugs i would like it )

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								The first thing you should ask yourself is why do i want to buy this. This question will determine if this game is worth the money or not. If you want a in depth game with a ton of content that is streamlined and explained well then this isnt for you... at all. The game is tricky to understand and does not feel familar to skate or tony hawk fans. While the controls work well, they could have been much better. a recommondation would be to make it like skate's right analog stick for tricks and jumping while a boosts your speed. Lets talk about speed. Going fast and pulling off a tough trick is the best part about this game. However there are times when you only go about 50 kps and those parts are monotonous to say the best. The biggest problem is you cant even go faster in these parts, you are pretty much capped at 50. Anyways no sound also is a HUGE dissapointment. This game once sound is added will be very relaxing. I guess until then just use spotify. Even though I dont recommend it i still enjoy this game and am looking forward to see it progress

content:
Posted: January 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								The only cons I could find are:UI is kinda broken, especially after crashing. Controller has no pause button (?)Game's unoptimized as all hell. My CPU temperature reached 64°C. Prime95 could only push it up to 58-59°C after 24 hours. GPU was also pushed to 73°C, 72°C being the highest it ever reached. Still, it runs really well.There's really no tutorial. Either that or the game forgot to explain me how to play.One time I landed so hard the game literally froze.Still, this could (and probably will) be SSX's spiritual successor.

								This game has a lot of potential but at the moment I wouldnt recommend that you play it. The mechanics are kind of bad on the keyboard and what can kill you while playing is really really stupid. What I suggest the creators do if they want people to play is make the controls better and the mechanics of the player or character better because he is really slow and it makes the gameplay not look smooth like most games should be. Basically what im trying to say is upgrade EVERYTHING and add things to the game what people may find interesting. Im not hating on this game because like I said it has potential but I really think it needs improving. content:
Posted: June 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've got this game since it's on steam early access, first it took ages to get the snowboarding in it, was promes long before. but now it's out and I finally tested it, I think it's to slow, if you mess up the landing of a trick you end up stand still and will have to push for ages before you regain some speed.. even then speed sensations is not good at all.the tricks are ok to executes, the rotation are difficult to control, you often spin without controlling the velocity and style.far to many rocks on a slope... ok this is suppose to be a mountain in the Alps, but common ! there is not fast enough response from the controls to avoid collisions and collision are to easy, any small clipping will end up with bad crash, impossible to recover.graphics look ok..ish, don't get me wrong this is good looking, but when you see title like Steep coming out fall 2016... ! I think Snow took to long to come to the stage of development it is now and it feels clumsy  with the controls, the trail of the snow from the back of the player while in normal camera looks glitchy, your snowboard or skis will just dives in the terrain... I do still recommend it, as it still quite fun, but could really do with some big inprovements with speed and controls

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Beautiful graphics, thanks to the CryEngine, fluid trick control and a lot of future potential. There are currently no objectives, so don't purchase this game unless you can have fun just skiing around a mountain with your own music playing. (Which I love doing) Also don't purchase this game if you want snowboarding, the devs have said many times that snowboarding will be included later on in devemopment. The game has improved a lot since I purchased it, and will only continue to be better, and will no doubt be one of the best skiing/snowboarding games.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								On paper a fun game and recently since Snowboards and Snowmobiles were added I decided to give the game a shot.  It's fun at face value but there are still many bugs.  All of the customisation items were locked up in the store recently and there is no way to acquire them yet short of paying.  Your character randomly dies at points too, often in the middle of a run or on flat ground so it's frustrating trying to build up enough exp.  Also some levels dont grant any coins on rank up which has to be a bug as well.  Lastly the game just seemingly and randomly CTD's when playing multiplayer.  Also framerate takes a dive in MP as well for no apparent reason.  My advice, quickly add the parks/snowmobiles (shouldnt take more than a week unless your art team is lazy) and fix the bugs.  No point adding new features to a game when players keep crashing to desktop, lagging, dying for no reason and have no way to customise their characters and gear.  I'm gunna keep playing it here and there but for now it's a "log in 1h a month drunk" game.  Avoid unless you're a total snowboarding nut, are drunk or just wanna ♥♥♥♥ around with mates.  If you want a serious skiing game with progression and gear unlocks wait a month or two.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have always wanted an awesome ski and snowboard game to play around with when I'm not on the slopes, and this game is just that. To start off I want to say that I love this game and hope that it keeps improving. There are many good features about this game, such as the beautiful environment and the control you have over the charcter. If you are into skiing or snowboarding I recommend this game, but if you are not then you might as well wait till it is free. I love the way you are able to control your charcter through spins and flips, but there are many improvements that could be made. I want this game to be the best it could be, so here is my list of things that could be improved: 1: Crashing, I do not like how if you crash a menu screen pops up, I would rather that a crash animation is played and you can continue to ski.FIXED2: The controls are very hard to get used to, and I find it hard to control on the slopes (crashing almost every minute), and I do not like the way you jump, I would prefer if you could just press a key down to bend knees and release to jump.FIXED3: Better physics (still a little choppy escpecially when landing a jump)4: I am hopeing that there will be an increased input on the terrain park, bigger jumps, rails, not as crowded, or even a feature to be able to create your own park.COMINGSOON5: I hope that the creaters put just as much time in to make the snowboarder as they did the skiier since I would love to see some awesome snowboarding in this game.COMINGSOON6: A replay editor would be nice.ADDED7: Different camera angles so you can still ski but view the skiier at different angles.ADDED8: First person would be amazing, which I believe would make this game the greatest ski simulator ever made. I hated the shaun white firts person camera and if this was done, I would hope that the camera would actualy act as the charcters face and as you spin and do flips, the camera does the same giving the view of the skiier.FIXED9: Hopefully better optimization in the future for crappier computers like my own.10. Also I feel that this game should not be a free to play, since if it is not the creators will earn more money and will be able to put in more time and effort to make this into the best ski and board game ever.EDIT: Many of my previous problems have been fixed, and many more future wishes will be added in future updates!

content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								The fact that this game recieves so many ill concived reviews baffles me. This game is probably one of the best Free to Play games out there for PC. There is no Pay-2-Win aspects, because any in-game items that are purchased with the games currency are only cosmetic and do not change your stats whatsoever. The game may be a little glitchy but people fail to realize that its still in Early Access, and the fact that some people compare this (which is somewhat of a simulator) to SSX (an arcade style skiing game that has absolutly nothing in common except for the sport) is part of the reason this game gets so many negative reviews, even though it doesn't deserve it. Its F2P so theres nothing to lose and if you don't like it uninstall it, but just get the game because its soo good

content:
Posted: November 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Disclaimer: I like this game. It has some things which make me not recommend it, which I will discuss in this little review.Single player: OK if you want to free roam. Bad if you want to do races of which there are only single person races such as time trials and "get a high score of X" and other variants of these modes.Multiplayer: What can I say about multiplayer...It is missing most features that makes single player fun. Such as ragdolls, drones and first person mode.Microtransactions: Theres a ♥♥♥♥♥onne if you want to buy things such as clothes and skis/snowboards. You have to pay for snowmobiles 2 times. That's 1 time more than expected. There is literally no money to be gotten from playing this game. I made around 140 gold* from 7 hours of play. That was enough for...1 hat and 1 mask...they were some of the cheaper items in the game. There are some items available to purchase with real money on the store which is horrible. You cannot choose the colour of the item you buy and you cannot preview them in any way. If you want to buy the in game currency, be prepared to bring a weeks paycheck...they cost WAAAAAAAAYYYY too much.*Gold is what I call the in game currency.Why can't the SJWs target microtransactions instead of people who have different political opinions?
