content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								The fact that this game recieves so many ill concived reviews baffles me. This game is probably one of the best Free to Play games out there for PC. There is no Pay-2-Win aspects, because any in-game items that are purchased with the games currency are only cosmetic and do not change your stats whatsoever. The game may be a little glitchy but people fail to realize that its still in Early Access, and the fact that some people compare this (which is somewhat of a simulator) to SSX (an arcade style skiing game that has absolutly nothing in common except for the sport) is part of the reason this game gets so many negative reviews, even though it doesn't deserve it. Its F2P so theres nothing to lose and if you don't like it uninstall it, but just get the game because its soo good

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's free, so it's hard to give this game a bad review.But single player is pretty boring, once you hit level 50 its pointless and you can manage to hit that within a couple of hours of gameplay pretty easily.This games all about multiplayer, it would be truely amazing! if it worked...No matter what, it's basically near impossible to play. it's more like cycling through some pictures, rather than frames per a second, it's like frames per a minute. Seriously, it's terrible!I have a high spec pc, its all set up perfectly, my internets one of the fastest in the UK.... You get the idea.Free awesome game, but it's truley pointless when you can't play it. It needs so much work it's probably just worth waiting for Steep, im at my wits end with it now. I won't even be playing it again if they do fix it im so fed up with the lack of Dev support etc.I think the amount of player's online speaks for itself i guess compared to the past. We're all sick of this now. I'd say sort it, but i honestly don't care after this review :)Stay away from this unless you want endless frustation after a couple of hours of awesomeness.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Disclaimer: I like this game. It has some things which make me not recommend it, which I will discuss in this little review.Single player: OK if you want to free roam. Bad if you want to do races of which there are only single person races such as time trials and "get a high score of X" and other variants of these modes.Multiplayer: What can I say about multiplayer...It is missing most features that makes single player fun. Such as ragdolls, drones and first person mode.Microtransactions: Theres a ♥♥♥♥♥onne if you want to buy things such as clothes and skis/snowboards. You have to pay for snowmobiles 2 times. That's 1 time more than expected. There is literally no money to be gotten from playing this game. I made around 140 gold* from 7 hours of play. That was enough for...1 hat and 1 mask...they were some of the cheaper items in the game. There are some items available to purchase with real money on the store which is horrible. You cannot choose the colour of the item you buy and you cannot preview them in any way. If you want to buy the in game currency, be prepared to bring a weeks paycheck...they cost WAAAAAAAAYYYY too much.*Gold is what I call the in game currency.Why can't the SJWs target microtransactions instead of people who have different political opinions?

content:
Posted: December 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								Okay, I was sketchy on this game at first, but once I played it, I thought it was actually fun. Now yes, it's a free game (At least I think for now), and it's new, and yes it has bugs. But, I believe this game has a lot of potential. I'm sure when you see this game, however, you're going to think, "Hey, that's a knockoff of Steep!" Well, you're correct, but it's like the poor man's version of Steep. Some people just don't have enough money for Steep, so they'd like something else that was close to it, and yet get it for little to no price. That's what this game is for. Okay, enough of me blabbering on, what are the pros and cons?Pros:-Costs little to no money-Fun with friends-Big enviroment where you can do tricks and such-Easy to learn-Outfitted for lower PCsCons:-Bugs (But that's every game in it's alpha state- it's prone to change)-Limited Customization (For the moment)-Controls are a bit wonky (But can be fixed)-Low amounts of serversWhile we're talking about controls. content:
Posted: June 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								My Review of the Early Access Version of SNOWOverview:Pros : Good graphical fidelity           Fun and realistic gameplay           Free-to-Play system is unobtrusiveCons : Game stutters and chugs on every setting setup            Only a few mapsSee My Full Review Below:At the time of the writing of this review, my Steam Library tells me that I’ve pumped approximately 5 hours into SNOW, which is the minimum cut off point for the amount of time I spend in a game before writing a review. SNOW is a game about winter sports. It features an open world setting with numerous maps ranging in size from full blown alpine valley, to miniature Winter Olympics stadiums, as well as 3 types of sports: skiing(my favourite), snowboarding, and snowmobiling(admittedly I still haven't figured out how to access this!). The game is free to download, but features a free-to-play system whereby a player pays into the game through ‘micro-transactions’, in game transactions that either affect cosmetics or gameplay. However, so far I have not uncovered any glaring issues with this system in game as it appears that it only affects cosmetics, and possibly new maps.In regards to the gameplay, I feel obliged to point out first that I myself am at an intermediate level  for skiing in real life as well as video games, and as such know how skis should feel and handle properly. I have to say that this game really nails to feeling of momentum and flow with the skis, with me feeling pretty much in control the entire time, using my DualShock 4 controller, NOT the keyboard which I haven't experimented with yet. However, I especially love the easy to use immediate flick between first and third person, which provides the terrifying experience of hurtling down a mountain at 90mph, whenever you want. On top of that, the game supports VR with the Oculus Rift DK2, which I should imagine you would need 10 spare pairs of trousers handy for.The real problem with the game occurs in the performance category. I run everything at 1080p as a fair test, but vary the in game graphical settings to test performance accordingly. For some odd reason, this game runs exactly at the same FPS on its lowest and highest settings. It appears to run at about 30fps and keeps chugging and stuttering continuously, which is incredibly frustrating and when playing in a proper online event, sometimes costing you the win. It wouldn't annoy me that much as I would usually turn the details down, but if it runs the same either way, then what's the point? Another issue is the settings screen, which seems to auto change my settings after they’re applied which is incredibly frustrating if you want to turn that flipping motion blur off and it won't go away!Overall, I recommend that you download SNOW, it's free and only 4gb after all, as it provides some good quality looks and gameplay. If your hardware can stop it chugging, then bully for you. You got yourself a good game!My Hardware Specs:-	CPU : AMD-	GPU : EVGA Nvidia GTX 960 SC 4GB-	RAM : 8GB of some random stock Kingston RAM-	Motherboard : ASUS A-78M-	Storage : Some kind of Toshiba HDD

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								I recieved a key from the Devs as I signed up for the closed beta early.Alright, so if you look at all the negative reviews there is one complaint they have in common: Microtransactions. Normally I would be on their side, but these kinds of microtransactions are different. They grant you access to PURELY COSMETIC items, that in no way affect gameplay. It's a free-to-play game, obviously there are microtransactions, that's how this works. How else do expect the devs to make money off of this? A $60 AAA game that has microtransactions is something to be♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at, not this game. I haven't even seen these microtransactions in-game, but then again I couldn't care less if my character has bunny ears or devil horns. Alright, so a short overview of the actual game. You ski all over a mountain, doing tricks and discovering starting points to level up. The higher your level, the cooler places you can start from. Even though I've only played an hour or so, I can tell this game is not meant for short bursts of playtime. It took me the whole hour to level up once, and the first unlockable location I could find started at level 15. With the amount of actual content in this game, that bar is set a little high and you might not stick with it for that long. Personally I quite enjoy SNOW and will probably spend a lot of time playing it, I've just been so busy one hour is all I've been able to put into it. Alright so yeah the physics are a little.... physics-breaking, but to me that adds in a lot of fun. In real skiing, you can't do a 360 deg. spin, land on the side of a mountain, jump off into a backflip and land just in time to smash right into a tree, then pause and rewind to replay it over and over again: you can do that. You can use it any time for a deduction in points, but if you crash you can use a rewind feature to place you a few seconds before your death so that you can try to fix your mistakes, or remake your demise, whichever you prefer. Yeah this game isn't perfect, but what game is? And while it's in beta, I think it's important for more and more people to play so that the devs can fix as many issues as possible. If you don't like it, refund it and no harm done.

content:
Posted: January 10
Early Access Review
SNOW Review From a VeteranAs I now have over 2000 hours in this game, I'd like to add my own opinion to the review scene. Of course, steam glitched my hours and says I only have 4, but that isn't true. (I've also got 6 smurf accounts, each with about 500 hours, so I know what I'm talking about.) First of all, this game is free, and very easy to pick up, although extremely difficult to master. It's definitely worth at least playing from the most casual to advanced gamers out there. It has the most fun skiing trick mechanics I've ever seen (and I've played dozens of ski games. The point system also has come so far from the early days of the game. Playing this game makes me wish that I could ski in real life, but I can't because I live in the middle of the Punjabi Desert. The only salvation I have here is SNOW, it provides an atmosphere that I'm really there ontop of the mountain, ready to ski down.It saddens me seeing all these negative reviews for a masterpiece of a game. And it shows the state of our generation today where nobody actual spends the time to learn a good game, they expect instant entertainment. Anyways, get this game, give it some time and it will be fun.-Mohammad, from the Punjabi Desert

content:
Posted: January 14
Early Access Review
								Nowhere near ready yet.  However I see it's been in development since Oct 2013, so I have little hope.- Physics are terrible.  For a snow game, this is imperative to get right, but they're weird as hell.  Keep mashing the button that makes your character boost himself forward, and you can ski/snowboard uphill indefinitely.  Then you have the issue where you don't seem to accelerate correctly going downhill, but can carry that momentum indefininitely over flat or rough terrain.  You can test this by skiing/boarding to the bottom of the mountain, through a village, then just keep going through the rolling hills between the mountains.- Multiplayer doesn't work.  Period.  If you're in the Eastern US, don't bother.  You can try to join US East servers and the connection icon will spin indefinitely with no way to quit other than alt+F4.  Or you can join a European server with ~160 ping and stutter every two seconds, to the point where it's unplayable.  This is a major flaw since it's advertised as multiplayer.- no map or compass.  The freeroam portion hinges on being able to find new areas, but you have literally no way of telling where you are or where you've been.  From my research this has been a known demand to the devs since at least Oct 21st 2013, but in a news post on their site they say they have no idea how to implement an interactive map.  That's a very bad sign.- instead of letting you take off your gear and walking if you want to explore something uphill, you need to buy a five dollar (USD) snowmobile.  To go up a hill.  Assuming, of course, you can't trick the physics engine to send you uphill anyway.- Solo mode is utterly empty.  No life at all, no AI skiiers or boarders, you're the only one in a massive mountain range.  Very eery and ties into why having a broken multiplayer mode is a bad thing.- No snow physics and your equipment is always clipping.  Minor annoyance more than anything; it constantly looks like your character is riding across the snow in just their boots.  Your trail is just a 2D mask placed over the surface that also clips into the terrain.  This is a practice used since the 90s, by 2017 the devs should at least introduce some terrain deformation and be able to keep your character high enough above the terrain to not clip.  I only bring this up because literally every snowboarding/skiing game I can think of in the past decade has done this...In conclusion:  Very rough, very empty, very broken, from what I understand the devs are taking the money and running with it.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm sorry I have to do this guys (addressing the devs)... but (addressing the players) listen to me if you thought about getting this game.If you were in doubt about waiting for SNOW's F2P release or buying the early access pass, I can tell you straight away. Don't. Buy. It. As a professional skier I can tell you right away, this game doesn't replicate that atmonsphere what so ever. It lags, it trembles, you can bounce off a net-fence like 200 feet up the mountain but an almost head on colission with a tree only nudges you 10 inches to the left/right. It's not completely horrible, it has potential, but it's unplayable.Pros- good selection of stuff (maps, courses, jump, grinds, clothes -- although it practices microtransactions)- big environments- good music- stylish menu... and sadly that's about it.Cons- it runs like my grand grand grand father (on a laptop that could do GTA V at 40-50 FPS on Normal, 1280x720)- textures/objects suddenly appear in front of you- the devs are doing very slow work (still have a friend pending on Close Beta Access since day 1)- the camera is just bad, plain and simply bad, I don't get the feeling that's me who's skiing- you can't see the difference in terrain elevation or the difference between a slope and powder... at all... not kidding... and I could actually go on an on for a while.Laptop Specs:- i7-2630QM 2.0GHz CPU with 8 cores- nVidia GeForce 630M 2Gb- 4Gb RAM DDR3All in all, I would like you not to judge my lack of in-game time as I couldn't (not wouldn't) play because of the performance. I believe there are many people out there who consider buying it but, as a guy who was exactly in your shoes 2 hours ago, don't buy it. Just wait to for F2P release by playing good games. You'll say "that crazy guy was right all along" then.I'm sorry devs. Maybe you will fix this stuff soon. I also work in game development and I know how hard it is. Keep on trying, but not in the direction you're heading to right now.Best regards.TOTAL: 4/10.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								First off, this game is full of potential and I can't recommend it right now because there's still a lot to be done before it is in a stable state.1) You crash very frequently. This can be anything from sitting in the spawn menu too long to simply skiing off piste too fast. I do understand this game is VERY early access and this can be sorted however.2) The servers are too small. I have no doubt that ther server capacity will be increase further down the line but trying to join any server with friends is nigh on impossible. 12 slots per server (nearly all of which are US based) makes it very difficult to enjoy the main selling point of this game.3) Physics are iffy. By that I mean there doesn't seem to be any when you perfrom certain actions. For example, going straight down off piste snow DOES cause you to go off course and lose stability, but if you carve left and right you remain fixed to the ground. In my experience carving on off piste snow is more likely to make you crash than going straight down, addingsmall corrections here and there4) Character models need some work. Your character has a very default looking face; no smile and dead looking eyes. I think some work on the faces and posture of the skier could improve it drasticallyBesides these issues (which will most likely be fixed by the devs) the game can be fun. If you can get into a server with your friends you'll get a decent amount of enjoyment out of the core game, though as said before there is work to be done on SNOW. When that's done or a nice big update comes out, I'll edit my review accordingly :)

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								When it showed up in steam, SNOW was looking like a cool game with so much promise. As a winter sports fan and avid snowboarder, I naturally got excited and bought the game. Excitement ended right after the game was finished downloading and launched for the first time however.It was a disgrace that steam would (at the time) would allow such a pile of misery to be sold. Anyway, I thought I’d wait for updates and maybe, just maybe the game got better... It never happened unfortunately, when first released it was not even in a tech demo state. Fortunately it improved a lot from that state, however, the game is not in a good state after more than a year. Menus are still a mess. Skiing physics are a joke. Snow physics are non-existent. It seems like developers are wasting all their time on irrelevant stuff like licensed gear(more on this later), before making an actual game that works and plays well. And then there is the best part. I could swear when I purchased SNOW, store page did not mention game would go free to play when completed. The moment I realized the F2P thing, I got mad, very mad. Not because I care much about the money I paid. I honestly don’t. I can afford to lose $15 and not give a damn about it.However the whole business model of this company made me sick to my stomach. People should not be allowed to sell a game that will eventually go F2P. No wonder they are spending so much time and effort on licensed outfits and gear, instead of actually making a game. If ever completed -somehow I highly doubt it- SNOW will be nothing more than an advertising thingy. TLDR : Very incomplete and shows little promise. Avoid. Will go free anyway.

content:

								SNOW was a game I impulse bought after a skiing trip, to see how it was. The concept is smart, but it has been poorly executed with numerous technical glitches, difficult control scheme, and little overall gameplay guidence. Yes, I understand that it is a skiing game that doesent need a lot of guidence other than go down a mountain, but the lack thereof gives the game a very, VERY empty feeling. I am asking for a refund for this game, but since I got it over the 2 week limit (which I find a very discriminitory rule, especially for games that were gotten before the refund policy was enacted) its iffy. At this point, I find very little interest in the game, and hope that the game picks up and that I be proven wrong in future.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game sucks.Its basically Amped 3 for 360 with updated graphics.Yeah, thats right. Amped snowboarding, the ♥♥♥♥♥iest, most boring game you ever played..... All the animations are rigid, the board doesnt appear to bump or grind along the ground like in games like SSX on tour, the rider doesnt feel the bumps on his feet, the entire animations look robotic and fake ujst like in Amped.If you liked Amped, you will love this, im sure..If you hated Amped, like me, and thuoght it was one of the most boring , and poorly made snowboarding games ever,you wont like this. It doesnt have any of the sparkle of SSX or the 1080's of the past. It doesnt even have much sense of speed, or most importantly, the FEEL of the snow under the board just isnt there. Where as it is still present in a much older PS2/GC/XBOX game from 2005. This game is Amped... In all its boring glory.. if you like ultra-boring sims you will be happy but i think it lacks a certain amount of polish.. and flavor.. Also, SSX > Amped.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								Why did I pay for this heaping sack of fermented poop?First off, this is a paid for F2P game. . . all you're actually getting is some attrocious looking cosmetic stuff.  Sadly, when i bought this (Febuary 2014) I must have been tired and not have realized this.  If it had been in the genre of F2P (Like it should have) then I never would have paid a penny.  I actually beg the people reading this to wait until it's fully F2P before deciding to give them money.  It's bad. . . really bad.  You'd have more fun with Bad Rats.Now on to the game play.When I went to customize my character, all the logos and designs were blurred out and looked horrid.  So I got character set up in his blurry clothes and went to play.  It stuck on the loading screen for a few minutes and CRASH.  No error message was given. The game was closed and here was my desktop.  So I loaded it to give it another try.  Third person view seemed okay.  I did a backflip in midair and i did a grind on something.  Nothing impressive. I've seen better in the original tony hawk pro skater.  Fooled around a bit and that seemed like all i could figure out how to do other than crash and make my head flop around in a goofy fashion. After the first shot, I decided to try another track.  I don't know what I did, but I suddenly found myself in 1st person view.  This seemed kinda badass and actually easier to see what i was doing.  I actually kind of liked this. Almost had fun for a few minutes, then it wore thin and i closed it.Maybe in ANOTHER year or two they might have this up to the point of being playable. . . but not yet.  Seriously - save your money.

								Its not that I don't like this game, I do. It's a fun lil snowboarding game that almost reminds me of the SSX and Amped: Freestyle that I played back when I did the console thing. It's just there's a lotta bugs, the wipeouts are hilariouslyyyy bad (which might even convince some to play), the business model is a lil.... restrictive (though i understand they gotta make money to continue production). I'd honestly give this game a Thumbs Up if there wasn't a bug that happened to me every 20 minutes where my skiier would just freeze in animation and all my controls freeze up except steering so i look like a gmod prop hunt stiffy old man flying down a hill. Funny the first time, frustrating the 20th.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is a massive disappointment.  Looking for an SSX-style experience, I downloaded this game and tried to look past the fact that it's about skiing and not snowboarding.  I found joy in trying to get the hang of an interesting set of mechanics, mostly from the falls that ensued.  Overall, I would not recommend this game in its current state, for the following major reasons:[1] ControlsThe controls are clunky and hard to maneuver quickly with.  I imagine it would be nicer playing with a controller, but even with a variety of keyboard configurations there was just no comfortable way to control everything.[2] GameplayThe worlds are severely limited, despite what the game has advertised thus far.  I was expecting something open world or at least level-based with large maps.  A standard run on one of the terrain park maps is literally three nice tricks.  If I remember from SSX 3, you could go down from the top of the mountain to the bottom and it would take 25-45 minutes depending on your route and speed.[3] LimitedThe developers have focused entirely too much on making this a simulator and not enough on making it enjoyable.  I don't want to play a game about something I can basically do or figure out how to do in real life.  I want to soar in the clouds and do insane tricks which aren't even possible in real life.  I don't want to cruise around at 10 MPH down the bunny hill terrain park, I want to fly down a double black diamond and launch off of a kicker, 200 feet into the air.  The gameplay physics are insanely realistic, to the point where it's not even fun.2 stars out of 5.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2016
Early Access Review
USE A CONTROLLERThis is one of the few games I will ever recommened using a controller for but it just feels much much better with an xbox/ps game controller.This game is oddly relaxing, you can either pick to learn complex tricks that involve many grabs and spins or you can simply just go down slopes and enjoy the pretty view! If I had to compare this to any game I would say the skate 1 on console. I dont play many winter sports games so maybe that is a poor comparison but to my best judgement thats what it feels like. The first person view takes a bit to get used to but my god when you get the hang of it, it can be a trip. There are microtransactions for different hats, skiis, poles, tops but you do get in game credits for leveling up, you just have to play the game enough to get cool looking stuff! Other than the usual early access BS , bugs, random crashes (in game like invisible walls) this game is pretty solid. Free too, I mean what do you have to lose? Give this game a shot! Another strange thing in servers is sometimes I go to search and only see one US east coast server and then sometimes I go and see 4-5.

content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								As a lifelong skier, I've always wanted a game like Snow.  So believe me, I really, really want to like this game.  But in it's current state it's really not worth playing.  It seems to me like they've focused most of their efforts so far on making the game pretty and having lots of clothes rather than making the skiing fun.  It just feels clunky as hell, the skier seems to just have one large surface which is sliding along the snow, spin and flip speed is extremely difficult to control, turning, again, it doesn't feel like carving or sliding, it feels like you're playing as a box which you're rotating on it's current up axis.Hopefully these guys will get their priorities straight, because honestly, I wouldn't care if all the game had was a jump and a rail with one player model if the skiing actually felt like skiing.

								As a lifelong skier, I've always wanted a game like Snow.  So believe me, I really, really want to like this game.  But in it's current state it's really not worth playing. number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game isn't bad. It's astonishingly bad. Now, I'm not a stickler for physics and stuff. Clipping through stuff is fine, especially in early access, however there's so much wrong it's unplayable. We'll start with the good first, because it's not all bad. Some of the maps, Fochi in particular are pretty fun and the tricks are neat when you can land them.That's about all I can say I enjoyed.I think the biggest thing is the camera, it's placed directly behind your chacrater completely obscuring your vision. Skiing is all about being able to see where you're going, this simply doesn't replicate that feeling.The controls are floaty at bast, they simply don't have any tightness to them and things like being unable to cut when you're crouched are counter intuative and break what little immersion there is.The game is setup for a 360 controller but the menus don't recognize it sometimes, notably the options. And exiting a map is impossible through the recommended "press B to quit" option.While this is an early access game it's no where close to being playable. I certainly hope it can be pushed forward because certain parts do feel fun, but overall it's simply lacking.

Posted: January 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								SNOW is a great game to play singleplayer. It's a very relaxing but yet exciting experience. There are a few bugs in the game but it's still in early access so that's to be expected. I havent played much multiplayer because all of the servers have very high pings. Overall I would say download this game for a fun singleplayer experience but not for multiplayer.
